meanings.definition: The act of putting things together in a group.
meanings.sent1: During the science project, the students worked on the grouping of different colored marbles.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to complete the grouping of animals based on their habitats.
meanings.sent3: The grouping of socks by color made the laundry task more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the grouping of players into teams added a competitive edge.
meanings.sent5: The grouping of flowers by size created a beautiful arrangement.

meanings.definition: A set of things that are grouped together.
meanings.sent1: The toy store displayed a colorful grouping of stuffed animals in the window.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had a special offer on a grouping of fresh fruits.
meanings.sent3: The grouping of books on the shelf made it easy to find the one she wanted.
meanings.sent4: The grouping of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The grouping of stars in the night sky formed familiar constellations.

meanings.definition: The way in which people or things are divided into groups.
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, the teacher explained the grouping of students for the group project.
meanings.sent2: The grouping of countries based on their continents helped in understanding global diversity.
meanings.sent3: The grouping of vegetables in the grocery store by type made shopping easier.
meanings.sent4: The grouping of colors in the rainbow is a natural phenomenon.
meanings.sent5: The grouping of athletes into different categories for the competition was well-organized.
